Nome: Neon

Descri√ß√£o: Currently, the main data source is a SQL Server of a monolith application. But engineering team is working to start to break this monolith into several microservices. In this new scenario, I am responsible to build and architect a scalable data platform from the ground that supports the legacy and newcomers technologies to ingest, transform and make data available for consumption. 

- Apache Sqoop for batch extraction from SQL Server
- Kafka for data stream processing
- Python to extract from other sources of data (APIs, etc)
- AWS S3 for datalake using Parquet as main data format
- Airflow as data pipeline orchestration
- PySpark for data transformation 
- Setting up and maintain a Hive Metastore and Presto cluster as SQL engine and Jupyterhub for data consumption 
- Tableau as a data visualization tool 
Tempo de trabalho: 2019/2021 
N√≠vel: Data Engineer 

**
Nome: Grupo ZAP 
Localiza√ß√£o: S√£o Paulo Area, Brazil 
Descri√ß√£o: [VivaReal]
Built and maintained data pipeline using Luigi (Python) to orchestrate the data extraction from several microservices databases (MySQL, Postgres, MongoDB, etc) and other applications (Amplitude, Adjust, Google Analytics, Salesforce, Zendesk, etc), storing in Datalake (S3), transforming with Python and pySpark, and then loading to DW (Redshift/Spectrum/Athena) ready for consumption by business analysts and product managers using a SQL client or Redash as data visualization tool.

[Grupo Zap]
After the merger of VivaReal and Zap im√≥veis, the two main players in Brazil's real estate market, resulting in Grupo Zap. The Engineering team was restructured, and a Data Platform Squad was created to build a unified platform for the entire company. In this scenario, we had the opportunity to build a data platform from the ground relying mostly on open-source projects.

We choose to use Kafka as a main hub from other applications to the platform. Changelogs from microservices databases were produced in several Kafka topics in Avro format, using Schema Registry to control messages schema, then consumed and saved in Datalake (S3/HDFS) in Parquet format.

Used Apache Airflow to orchestrate data transformations with pySpark. Making data available for consumption with Metabase as a data visualization tool, Hive Metastore + Presto as SQL engine and Jupyterhub with ephemeral Spark clusters for analysts, data scientists, and other tech-savvy users.

Some consumer-facing applications required to show real-time and historical data to the users, we provided these data with Apache Druid.

Rewrote from scratch our in-house Clickstream Tracker solution, since our previous version had several scalability issues and lack of schema control that was causing problems through the entire pipeline processing. It was built with Nginx, Fluentd, Kafka and Kafka Streams.

Mostly of this stack is running on Kubernetes, except for some RDS (metastore databases) and S3 as our Datalake. 
Tempo de trabalho: 2016/2019

Descri√ß√£o: Creditas is a Fintech that offers financial products such as Auto Equity, Home Equity and Payroll. Our purpose is to be enablers of what fulfills people.

As a Software Engineer in Creditas I worked in 3 different squads.
I started working on the Communication squad, the challenge was to build a platform that manages and integrates all kinds of communications with our customers. That includes Voip(Webphone), Email, SMS and WhatsApp Business.
We developed new tools giving our non technical stakeholders autonomy to build triggers to notify our customers about our process, keeping them engaged.

Key Results from the team:
- Developed a service that is product agnostic. Allowing integrations with all current and future products, tracking and centralizing all communication and their visual identity.
- Automated all communication on the Auto Equity product.
- Improved our internal consultants efficiency on 10%.
- Empower our analytic team to do analyzes that was never done on our communication data.

Then I moved to the Auto Equity's Self Service squad and we are totally focused on customers experience. Our challenge is to build the best digital experience through our platform. Giving ownership and autonomy to our customers during the entire process.

Key Results from the team:
- Increased the automatic lead processing rate by 15%.
- Improved our User Experience with extensive use of A/B tests.

The last squad I worked on was the B2B squad. Our goal was to build public APIs allowing our partners to use our products. We worked very close to the stakeholders and our partners to be able to delivery the best experience for them.

Key Results from the team:
- Developed a new micro service that manages our partners. Extracting this responsibility from the monolith.
- Built a new micro front end platform that connects with the partner service, giving our internal consultants autonomy to manage our partners.
- Improved the monitoring and maintainability of our current API.

Name: Maria Clara Montes
Sum√°rio:
I've always loved the Product Management role, I just didn't know that it was called product management back when I was a teenager.

During my Industrial Engineering degree and the activities that I took part at that time, I learned that I was good at math and analysis, but that I also loved leading groups of people to achieve a common goal. Unfortunately, at Brazilian universities we don't learn about technology companies and how they structure work, so I consider myself lucky for having been selected to work as a Product Intern in my first job, even if I didn't know what to expect.

I fell in love with Product Management and everything in it, all the possibilities, the mix of analytical and management skills, the need of being and excelent communicator and the technical interface with developers. Since my first job, I was able to work in some great companies with great people and deliver some real value to customers. 

I've worked in a veriety of products, from simple SMS content-based products and a freight management platform to customizing the shopping experience at a beverage delivery app with a huge user base.
I have 4+ years of experience working with agile teams and methodologies, mainly SCRUM, applied priorization frameworks such as the ICE score and learned a lot about good communication with stakeholders.

I enjoy meeting new people and hearing new perspectives so feel free to reach out to talk about new technologies, product management trends or even videogames.

Name: Laura Duarte Meirelles
Sum√°rio:
Hi there, I am glad to have you reading my profile.

Since you are here, follow me with this situation:

When you are moving you expect your house renovations to be completed, your furniture and appliances delivered until the day you move. If the construction of your ceiling is delayed, you cannot move when expected. This will result in you losing trust and credibility in your supplier and worse than that, you will feel frustrated, discontent and it will result in unexpected extra expenses. 

Empathy: this is the way I work with the customers. We are all customers, and we like to be well attended or at least receive the service it was agreed and we paid for.

My job has always been to understand my customers dreams, their needs and the consequences of an eventual problem. I translate all of that to the team I am working with. And most important: I love doing this work. 

I am an Industrial Engineer and I developed my career in multinational industry companies where I had the opportunity to work with: Manufacturing, Project management, process improvement, data analysis, customer service, sales operations, account management which allowed me to understand the big picture of the product and customer journey. 

To make better decisions and to reach outstanding performance during the years, I‚Äôve been working cross-functionally to deep dive into the problems until I find the root cause, solve the problem, adjust the process and improve it continuously, always looking for innovating solutions.  

I am an enthusiastic, hands-on, action oriented person, I enjoy communicating, meeting new people. I prefer taking decisions based on data analysis and facts rather than intuition. 

Also, and again, I love meeting new people, so reach me out for a call, it will be a pleasure to exchange experiences with you =)

Specialties / Interests: Project management, process improvement, data analysis, customer experience, sales operations, account management, product management, change management, business intelligence, Lean, Agile, team development.
